intro: Pharmacosycea perforata, commonly known as the perforate pharmacosycea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves with distinctive perforations. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties, it has attracted interest in botanical research.
